Module it.polimi.ingsw.am11
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am11.model.cards.playable

Class PlayableCard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am11.model.cards.playable.PlayableCard
All Implemented Interfaces:
CardIdentity, FieldCard
Direct Known Subclasses:
GoldCard, ResourceCard
public abstract sealed class PlayableCard extends Object implements FieldCard permits GoldCard, ResourceCard
Abstract class representing a playable card in the field.

Subclasses must be constructed using the provided Builder inner class to ensure consistent object creation.

This class contains methods to get the card's color, points, type, placing requirements, points requirements, symbol to collect, and id.

It also contains methods to check if a corner is available if there is an item in a corner, and if the card's color is equal to a given color.

The class also contains a nested Builder class for creating instances of PlayableCard.

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayableCard

      protected PlayableCard (@NotNull @NotNull PlayableCard.Builder<?> builder)
      Constructs a new instance of PlayableCard using the provided Builder.

      This constructor is protected. This is to ensure that PlayableCard instances are always created using a Builder.

      The constructor takes a Builder as a parameter and uses it to set the color, points, and id of the PlayableCard. These values are final and canâ€™t be changed after the PlayableCard is constructed.

      Parameters:
      builder - The Builder used to construct the PlayableCard. It must be a subclass of Builder that is specific to the type of PlayableCard being created.

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Overrides the hashCode method for the PlayableCard class.

      This method uses the Integer's hashCode method to generate a hash code for the id of the PlayableCard.

      The id of a PlayableCard is unique, so this method ensures that different PlayableCards will have different hash codes.

      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      A hash code value for this PlayableCard.

    • equals

      public boolean equals (@NotNull @NotNull Object obj)
      Overrides the equals method for the PlayableCard class.

      This method first checks if the passed object is equal to the current object using the superclasses equal method. If theyâ€™re equal, it returns true.

      If the passed object is not of the same class as the current object, it returns false.

      Finally, it checks if the id of the passed object is equal to the id of the current object. If theyâ€™re equal, it returns true.

      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:

    • getPlacingRequirements

      @Contract(pure=true) @NotNull public abstract @NotNull Map<GameColor,Integer> getPlacingRequirements()
      Gets the number of colors in the field needed to place the card.

      For ResourceCard all color requirements will be 0 as they have no requirements to place.

      Returns:
      a Map of keys colors and as values their requirements to place on the field in int

    • getPointsRequirements

      @Contract(pure=true) @NotNull public abstract @NotNull PointsRequirementsType getPointsRequirements()
      Gets the method needed to score this card points value.

      If the card doesn't give points it will return PointsRequirementsType.CLASSIC as the card points value would be 0.

      Returns:
      type of requirement needed to score points
      See Also:
      • PointsRequirementsType

    • getItemCorner

      @Contract(pure=true) @NotNull public abstract @NotNull CornerContainer getItemCorner (@NotNull @NotNull Corner corner)
      Checks if there is an item in a specified corner of the PlayableCard.

      The method returns a CornerContainer object representing the item or its Availability.

      The method is marked as pure, meaning it doesnâ€™t modify the state of the object and only returns a value.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      A CornerContainer object on the specified corner.
      See Also:

    • getSymbolToCollect

      @Contract(pure=true) @NotNull public abstract @NotNull Optional<Symbol> getSymbolToCollect()
      Getter method for the symbol to collect if there is any

      A Symbol is present when the card PointsRequirementsType is SYMBOLS, otherwise it will return an empty Optional.

      Returns:
      a symbol if the cards permits a symbol to collect otherwise an empty Optional

      @NotNull public @NotNull Set<GameColor> getCenter (boolean isRetro)
